sndlib.core.solution
Class DemandRouting

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.solution.DemandRouting

public final class DemandRouting
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a routing for a single traffic Demand belonging to a specific Solution.

A demand routing specifies the operating state in which it is valid and a set of FlowPaths defining the whole routing. Each of the flow paths has a flow value and a path on which the flow is routed.

For constructing a new DemandRouting a parent Solution is needed.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
Solution, Solution.newRouting(String, OperatingState), FlowPath, Demand, OperatingState

flowPathCount

public int flowPathCount()
Returns the number of flow paths in this demand routing.
A flow path count greater than one indicates that this demand routing is a bifurcated routing.

Returns:
the number of flow paths in this demand routing

flowPaths

public java.util.List<FlowPath> flowPaths()
Returns a List view of the flow paths in this demand routing.

The returned list is unmodifiable. That means that each attempt to modify the list will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
an unmodifiable list view of the flow paths in this demand routing.

containsLink

public boolean containsLink(java.lang.String linkId)
Tests whether one of the flow paths in this demand routing traverses the specified link.

Parameters:
linkId - the ID of the link
Returns:
true if and only if one of the flow paths in this demand routing traverses the specified link; false otherwise
